thread.title: Obama on budget: Time for Congress 'to do its job'
thread.title_full: Obama on budget: Time for Congress 'to do its job' - POLITICO

author: Eliza Collins
title: Obama on budget: Time for Congress 'to do its job'
text:
Despite the modest job growth announced Friday, President Barack Obama had a grim message for Congress: If you don’t get it together, the economy will worsen. The economy would be “doing even better if we didn’t have to keep dealing with unnecessary crises in Congress,” the president said at a press conference Friday. “Our own growth could slow if Congress does not do away with some of the counterproductive austerity measures that they have put in place.”
The economy added just 142,000 jobs last month.
Obama brought up congressional action earlier this week where he said more than half of Republicans “voted to shut down the government for the second time in two years.”
“That gimmick only sets up another potentially manufactured crisis just two weeks before Christmas,” Obama said. “This is not the way the U.S. should be operating.”
There's more Obama can do on gun control, advocates say By Sarah Wheaton
He also expressed his opposition to another temporary budget deal. "The bottom line is Congress has to do its job."
Obama said that people are often calling on the U.S. to take back a leadership role in the world. “You know what? Around the world, part of what makes us a leader is when we govern effectively and we keep our own house in order,” he said. "We can grow faster and the economy can improve if Congress acts with dispatch. It will get worse if they don’t.”
